title_sort: william h. millis, jr. to walt whitman, 25 february 1875
title: William H. Millis, Jr. to Walt Whitman, 25 February 1875
text: Dover, Delaware,February 25, 1875Beloved Friend,Your Letter & Picture & Paper came safe. I hope you will excuse me for not writing sooner I have been laid up with a pain in my back ever since tuesday last, but I am feeling better at this present time & hope to [be] able to go work tomorrow [morn]ing. I cant[can't] find words to tell you how thankful I am for the Picture. I dont[don't] think that I ever had a present that I think more of than I do it. I am agoing to have it framed if nothing happensI want that Picture to remain in my family as long as thier[there] is a member of it living. I would like very much to see you & have a long talk with you & if nothing happens I want you to visit us soon as the Weather gets pleasanter. We are as comfortable as the most of poor people that has to labor for a living. this is a very plaesent[pleasant] place in the summer time when the trees are all out in full bearing.I will stop hopeing[hoping] this may find you improving in health.. also with much love & many thanks from myself & my Wife William H. Millis, Jr. to Walt Whitman, 25 February 1875
